naming_conventions.description: Use proper English names instead of romanized Japanese names to maintain European fantasy aesthetic
naming_conventions.rationale: Romanized names (e.g., 'Aaru Kuroobaa') break immersion in European aristocratic fantasy settings. Proper English names (e.g., 'Earl Clover') maintain genre conventions.
naming_conventions.implementation: Always reference character_roster in manifest.json for canonical English names

honorifics_system.description: Replace Japanese honorifics with Fantasy Vietnamese equivalents appropriate to aristocratic hierarchy
honorifics_system.rationale: Japanese honorifics (-san, -sama, -kun, -chan) break immersion in European fantasy. Vietnamese has rich formal/informal registers suitable for aristocratic settings.

-sama.usage: For nobility, especially ladies of high rank
-sama.context: Formal address showing respect to aristocrats
examples: Điện hạ-sama → Điện hạ (royalty - already Vietnamese)

-san.context: Between nobles of similar rank or acquaintances

-kun.vietnamese: [remove - use name directly or add 'thiếu gia' for young masters]
-kun.context: From superiors to male juniors or between male friends
examples: Earl-kun → thiếu gia Earl (young master, if from servants)

special_titles.Điện hạ: Your Highness/Majesty (for royalty) - KEEP AS IS
special_titles.ngài: Lord/Sir (for male nobility or high-ranking individuals)
special_titles.thiếu gia: Young master (for noble young men, from servants)

sino_vietnamese_policy.description: Maximum 40% Sino-Vietnamese vocabulary to maintain European aristocratic fantasy aesthetic
sino_vietnamese_policy.rationale: Excessive Sino-Vietnamese creates Wuxia/martial arts aesthetic. European fantasy requires Western-origin terminology.
prioritize_pure_vietnamese: Botanical family names (Clover, Hyacinth, Muscat, Marigold, Iris, Protea)
European noble titles (Count, Marquis, Duke, Baron, Viscount)
Western cultural concepts (academy, aristocracy, engagement, social season)
acceptable_sino_vietnamese: Generic titles when no pure Vietnamese equivalent exists
avoid_sino_vietnamese: Martial arts terminology (this is European fantasy, not Wuxia)

good.names: Earl Clover, Lena Hyacinth, Alphonse King Protea
good.titles: Bá tước (Count), Hầu tước (Marquis), Công tước (Duke)
good.locations: Vương quốc Thánh Protea, Lãnh địa Clover

bad.titles: Overuse of 武侯/武士 (Wuxia aesthetics)

pronoun_progression.description: Track relationship development through Vietnamese pronoun shifts from formal to intimate
pronoun_progression.rationale: Vietnamese has rich pronoun systems that naturally express relationship intimacy. Track progression to guide translators.

formal_strangers.honorifics: Use full titles (tiểu thư Lena, ngài Earl)

polite_acquaintances.honorifics: Can drop titles in casual contexts

intimate_romantic.honorifics: Names only, no titles in private

pronoun_progression.tracking_method: Use pronouns_progress array in character metadata to document relationship milestones

progression.trigger: Earl asks her to drop honorifics after ~1 week

social_terms.debutante: thiếu nữ ra mắt xã hội

character_description_style.emphasis: European beauty standards and fantasy aesthetics
character_description_style.avoid: Anime/manga descriptors common in Japanese light novels

good: mái tóc vàng buộc nửa đầu (half-up golden hair)
đôi mắt tím như thạch anh tím (violet eyes like amethyst)
tóc bạc dài đến lưng (waist-length silver hair)
mỹ nam với nét đẹp bishonen (handsome with bishonen features)
acceptable_but_clarify: bishonen → clarify as 'mỹ nam Âu châu' (European handsome man)
ojou-sama → translate as 'tiểu thư quý tộc' (noble lady)

narrative_voice.register: Informal first-person with literary embellishments for fantasy atmosphere
narrative_voice.protagonist_voice: Modern reincarnated otaku in fantasy world - blend casual modern thinking with respect for fantasy setting
style_notes: Maintain protagonist's inner monologue informality (colloquial Vietnamese)
Use elevated register for noble dialogue and formal scenes
Fantasy world-building terms should feel natural in Vietnamese
Avoid excessive formality that creates distance from reader

step_1_character_names.action: Convert all romanized names to English names
step_1_character_names.tool: Search and replace with character roster lookup

step_2_honorifics.action: Replace Japanese honorifics with Vietnamese fantasy equivalents

step_3_sino_vocabulary.action: Review Sino-Vietnamese ratio and adjust if exceeds 40%

step_4_pronoun_tracking.action: Verify pronoun usage matches relationship progression
step_4_pronoun_tracking.tool: Context analysis with character relationship state

red_flags: ⚠ Wuxia terminology (e.g., 宗門, 武林)
⚠ Anime descriptor not adapted (tsundere, kawaii raw)

villainess_terminology.note: This is a 'villainess' genre story - antagonist female character who may be redeemed
villainess_terminology.vietnamese: nữ phản diện / tiểu thư phản diện
villainess_terminology.context: Protagonist is a fan of villainess characters, not a villain himself

isekai_reincarnation.note: Protagonist retains memories from modern Japan but lives in European fantasy world
isekai_reincarnation.voice: Allow occasional modern references in internal monologue to show reincarnated nature
